description: pytest: helps you write better programs.

options.description: Only run tests which match the given substring expression. An expression is a Python evaluable expression where all names are substring-matched against test names and their parent classes.
options.name: -k

options.description: Only run tests matching given mark expression. For example: -m 'mark1 and not mark2'.
options.name: -m

options.description: Show markers (builtin, plugin and per-project ones).
options.name: --markers

options.description: Exit instantly on first error or failed test
options.name: -x, --exitfirst

options.description: Show available fixtures, sorted by plugin appearance (fixtures with leading '_' are only shown with '-v')
options.name: --fixtures, --funcargs

options.description: Show fixtures per test
options.name: --fixtures-per-test

options.description: Start the interactive Python debugger on errors or KeyboardInterrupt
options.name: --pdb

options.description: Specify a custom interactive Python debugger for use with --pdb. For example: --pdbcls=IPython.terminal.debugger:TerminalPdb
options.name: --pdbcls

options.description: Immediately break when running each test
options.name: --trace

options.description: Per-test capturing method: one of fd|sys|no|tee-sys
options.name: --capture

options.description: Shortcut for --capture=no
options.name: -s

options.description: Report the results of xfail tests as if they were not marked
options.name: --runxfail

options.description: Rerun only the tests that failed at the last run (or all if none failed)
options.name: --lf, --last-failed

options.description: Run all tests, but run the last failures first. This may re-order tests and thus lead to repeated fixture setup/teardown.
options.name: --ff, --failed-first

options.description: Run tests from new files first, then the rest of the tests sorted by file mtime
options.name: --nf, --new-first

options.description: Show cache contents, don't perform collection or tests. Optional argument: glob (default: '*').
options.name: --cache-show

options.description: Remove all cache contents at start of test run
options.name: --cache-clear

options.description: With ``--lf``, determines whether to execute tests when there are no previously (known) failures or when no cached ``lastfailed`` data was found. ``all`` (the default) runs the full test suite again. ``none`` just emits a message about no known failures and exits successfully.
options.name: --lfnf, --last-failed-no-failures

options.description: Exit on test failure and continue from last failing test next time
options.name: --sw, --stepwise

options.description: Ignore the first failing test but stop on the next failing test. Implicitly enables --stepwise.
options.name: --sw-skip, --stepwise-skip

options.description: Show N slowest setup/test durations (N=0 for all)
options.name: --durations

options.description: Minimal duration in seconds for inclusion in slowest list. Default: 0.005.
options.name: --durations-min

options.description: Increase verbosity
options.name: -v, --verbose

options.description: Disable header
options.name: --no-header

options.description: Disable summary
options.name: --no-summary

options.description: Do not fold skipped tests in short summary.
options.name: --no-fold-skipped

options.description: Decrease verbosity
options.name: -q, --quiet

options.description: Set verbosity. Default: 0.
options.name: --verbosity

options.description: Show extra test summary info as specified by chars: (f)ailed, (E)rror, (s)kipped, (x)failed, (X)passed, (p)assed, (P)assed with output, (a)ll except passed (p/P), or (A)ll. (w)arnings are enabled by default (see --disable-warnings), 'N' can be used to reset the list. (default: 'fE').
options.name: -r

options.description: Disable warnings summary
options.name: --disable-warnings, --disable-pytest-warnings

options.description: Show locals in tracebacks (disabled by default)
options.name: -l, --showlocals

options.description: Hide locals in tracebacks (negate --showlocals passed through addopts)
options.name: --no-showlocals

options.description: Traceback print mode (auto/long/short/line/native/no)
options.name: --tb

options.description: Show tracebacks for xfail (as long as --tb != no)
options.name: --xfail-tb

options.description: Controls how captured stdout/stderr/log is shown on failed tests. Default: all.
options.name: --show-capture

options.description: Don't cut any tracebacks (default is to cut)
options.name: --full-trace

options.description: Color terminal output (yes/no/auto)
options.name: --color

options.description: Whether code should be highlighted (only if --color is also enabled). Default: yes.
options.name: --code-highlight

options.description: Send failed|all info to bpaste.net pastebin service
options.name: --pastebin

options.description: Create junit-xml style report file at given path
options.name: --junitxml, --junit-xml

options.description: Prepend prefix to classnames in junit-xml output
options.name: --junitprefix, --junit-prefix

options.description: Set which warnings to report, see -W option of Python itself
options.name: -W, --pythonwarnings

options.description: Exit after first num failures or errors
options.name: --maxfail

options.description: Any warnings encountered while parsing the `pytest` section of the configuration file raise errors
options.name: --strict-config

options.description: Markers not registered in the `markers` section of the configuration file raise errors
options.name: --strict-markers

options.description: (Deprecated) alias to --strict-markers
options.name: --strict

options.description: Load configuration from `FILE` instead of trying to locate one of the implicit configuration files.
options.name: -c, --config-file

options.description: Force test execution even if collection errors occur
options.name: --continue-on-collection-errors

options.description: Define root directory for tests. Can be relative path: 'root_dir', './root_dir', 'root_dir/another_dir/'; absolute path: '/home/user/root_dir'; path with variables: '$HOME/root_dir'.
options.name: --rootdir

options.description: Only collect tests, don't execute them
options.name: --collect-only, --co

options.description: Try to interpret all arguments as Python packages
options.name: --pyargs

options.description: Ignore path during collection (multi-allowed)
options.name: --ignore

options.description: Ignore path pattern during collection (multi-allowed)
options.name: --ignore-glob

options.description: Deselect item (via node id prefix) during collection (multi-allowed)
options.name: --deselect

options.description: Only load conftest.py's relative to specified dir
options.name: --confcutdir

options.description: Don't load any conftest.py files
options.name: --noconftest

options.description: Keep duplicate tests
options.name: --keep-duplicates

options.description: Don't ignore tests in a local virtualenv directory
options.name: --collect-in-virtualenv

options.description: Prepend/append to sys.path when importing test modules and conftest files. Default: prepend.
options.name: --import-mode

options.description: Run doctests in all .py modules
options.name: --doctest-modules

options.description: Choose another output format for diffs on doctest failure
options.name: --doctest-report

options.description: Doctests file matching pattern, default: test*.txt
options.name: --doctest-glob

options.description: Ignore doctest collection errors
options.name: --doctest-ignore-import-errors

options.description: For a given doctest, continue to run after the first failure
options.name: --doctest-continue-on-failure

options.description: Base temporary directory for this test run. (Warning: this directory is removed if it exists.)
options.name: --basetemp

options.description: Display pytest version and information about plugins. When given twice, also display information about plugins.
options.name: -V, --version

options.description: Show help message and configuration info
options.name: -h, --help

options.description: Early-load given plugin module name or entry point (multi-allowed). To avoid loading of plugins, use the `no:` prefix, e.g. `no:doctest`.
options.name: -p

options.description: Trace considerations of conftest.py files
options.name: --trace-config

options.description: Store internal tracing debug information in this log file. This file is opened with 'w' and truncated as a result, care advised. Default: pytestdebug.log.
options.name: --debug

options.description: Override ini option with "option=value" style, e.g. `-o xfail_strict=True -o cache_dir=cache`.
options.name: -o, --override-ini

options.description: Control assertion debugging tools. 'plain' performs no assertion debugging. 'rewrite' (the default) rewrites assert statements in test modules on import to provide assert expression information.
options.name: --assert

options.description: Only setup fixtures, do not execute tests
options.name: --setup-only

options.description: Show setup of fixtures while executing tests
options.name: --setup-show

options.description: Show what fixtures and tests would be executed but don't execute anything
options.name: --setup-plan

options.description: Level of messages to catch/display. Not set by default, so it depends on the root/parent log handler's effective level, where it is "WARNING" by default.
options.name: --log-level

options.description: Log format used by the logging module
options.name: --log-format

options.description: Log date format used by the logging module
options.name: --log-date-format

options.description: CLI logging level
options.name: --log-cli-level

options.description: Log format used by the logging module
options.name: --log-cli-format

options.description: Log date format used by the logging module
options.name: --log-cli-date-format

options.description: Path to a file when logging will be written to
options.name: --log-file

options.description: Log file open mode
options.name: --log-file-mode

options.description: Log file logging level
options.name: --log-file-level

options.description: Log format used by the logging module
options.name: --log-file-format

options.description: Log date format used by the logging module
options.name: --log-file-date-format

options.description: Auto-indent multiline messages passed to the logging module. Accepts true|on, false|off or an integer.
options.name: --log-auto-indent

options.description: Disable a logger by name. Can be passed multiple times.
options.name: --log-disable
